newsitem.title: UK: Granada off, single seller pinpointed.
newsitem.headline: Granada off, single seller pinpointed.

text.p: Shares in Granada Group Plc headed back towards its recent three-month lows amid talk of a single broker aggressively selling the stock, dealers said on Tuesday.
Granada shares were off 13 pence at 875p bid by 0950 GMT on volume of 650,000.
"There has been a single seller in there, selling pretty aggressively," said one trader at a U.S. bank.
The price has spent several previous sessions recovering from three-month lows on April 14-15 at 863p, a level previously seen on January 24.
In the interim the stock peaked at 984p on March 12, the day before Granada said it had no plans to bid for Yorkshire-Tyne Tees Television Holdings Plc.
